summary: The 'Ban Military Drones Spying on Civilians Act' (H.R. 4759) prohibits the use of certain unmanned aircraft vehicles (specifically, the MQ-9 Reaper and other specified aircraft) by the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Defense, and other federal agencies to surveil U.S. persons engaged in protests or civil disobedience. The bill mandates annual reports to Congress detailing any such drone usage, including the purpose, justification, location, duration, and whether any U.S. persons were surveilled and how their information was handled. It defines the relevant terms and specifies the congressional committees that will receive the reports.
